title: Mainly dry weather expected in most parts of the island today
byline: Mainly dry weather will prevail in most parts of the island today, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Oracle says data center outage causing issues faced by US TikTok users
byline: Oracle on Tuesday said issues faced by U.S. users of social media app TikTok are the result of a temporary weather-related power outage at an Oracle data center, after California Governor Gavin Newsom linked the issues to what he called the suppression of content critical of President Donald Trump.

title: Nearly 800 individuals arrested in “Nation United” island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: Nearly 800 individuals have been arrested yesterday (27) under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign, aimed at eradicating the drug menace from the country.

title: Ambalangoda shooting linked to ‘extramarital relationship’, police say
byline: Police investigations have revealed that the fatal shooting of a 28-year-old man in the Tsunamiwatta area of Ambalangoda yesterday (27) was allegedly carried out over an ‘extramarital relationship’.

title: Young woman beaten to death following domestic dispute in Angulana
byline: A 24-year-old woman has died after allegedly being assaulted by her extramarital partner following a dispute, police stated.

title: Donald Trump says “Cuba will be failing pretty soon”
byline: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that “Cuba will be failing pretty soon,” adding that Venezuela, once the island’s top supplier, has not recently sent oil or money to Cuba.

title: E-Gates introduced at BIA Arrival Terminal
byline: The first Automated Border Control (ABC) electronic gates (e–gate) at the arrival terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) will be officially opened from today (28), the Department of Immigration and Emigration has announced.

title: iPhone 18 series launching soon, Apple likely to surprise with pricing
byline: We have all heard about the rising RAM prices, thanks to the demand from AI data centres. Now, as per reports, it seems that Apple cannot stay immune to this hike either.

title: Gotabaya Rajapaksa, others to be served notices over alleged unlawful compensation for Aragalaya torched houses, SC rules
byline: The Supreme Court today directed to serve notices on several respondents, including former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, in connection with a Fundamental Rights (FR) petition ...

title: New circular issued to assist disaster-affected micro, small and self-employed businesses
byline: A new circular has been issued by the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to provide relief to micro, small and self-employed businesses affected by the disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Aswesuma January allowance credited to beneficiaries’ accounts
byline: The January allowance for beneficiaries who qualified for the first and second phases of the Aswesuma program has been deposited to the bank accounts of the beneficiaries, the Ministry of Finance has announced.

title: Storm Chandra brings heavy rain, flooding and travel disruption to UK
byline: Large parts of the UK have been hit by strong winds and flooding as Storm Chandra sweeps across the country.

title: GMOA Central Committee to decide on intensifying TU action
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) states that if the government fails to act swiftly to provide solutions to their issues, a decision to further intensify trade union action will be announced today (28).

title: Price of 24-carat gold sovereign crosses Rs. 400,000 in Sri Lanka
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has risen significantly following the continuous increase in global gold prices.

title: South Korea court sentences ex-first lady Kim to jail term for bribery
byline: A South Korean court on Wednesday sentenced former First Lady Kim Keon Hee to one year and eight months in jail after finding her guilty of accepting bribes from Unification Church officials in return for political favours.

title: Central Bank keeps policy rate unchanged
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka has decided to maintain the Overnight Policy Rate at 7.75%, following its latest Monetary Policy Board meeting held yesterday.

title: Trinco Buddha statue incident: Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others brought to court
byline: Ten suspects, including Venerable Balangoda Kassapa Thero and other monks, who are currently in remand custody in connection with the Trincomalee Buddha statue incident, have been brought to court.

title: Pakistan PM’s special assistant begins three-day visit to Sri Lanka
byline: Haroon Akhtar Khan, the Special Assistant to the Prime Minister of Pakistan on Industries and Production, has arrived in Sri Lanka on a three-day official visit.

title: Four persons killed in separate road accidents
byline: Four individuals, including three women have died in four separate road accidents that occurred in several areas yesterday, police stated.

title: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar killed in plane crash in Pune
byline: Ajit Pawar, NCP chief and Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died in a tragic plane crash this morning while he was flying from Mumbai to Baramati.

title: Court orders Jaffna MC to submit report on air pollution control measures
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered the Jaffna Municipal Council to submit a report on the measures taken to reduce air pollution in the Jaffna area.

title: Nearly 2 million military casualties in Ukraine war: Report
byline: Russia’s grinding invasion of Ukraine has caused nearly two million military casualties -- killed, wounded or missing -- between the two countries, according to a study published Tuesday by a US think tank.

title: ‘Need Texans First’: Texas halts H-1B hiring at state colleges, agencies
byline: Governor Greg Abbott ordered Texas universities and state agencies on Tuesday to halt new H-1B visa petitions, which are used by employers to hire foreign workers with specialized skills, until next year.

title: Arijit Singh at 38 announces retirement from playback singing
byline: Singer Arijit Singh has announced that he is stepping away from playback singing.

title: Mexico president asks South Korea for more BTS concerts
byline: The scramble for tickets to K-pop band BTS’ comeback tour, which comes after a four-year hiatus, has seen Mexico’s president appealing to her South Korean counterpart to add more shows in her country.

title: Trinco Buddha Statue Incident: Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others further remanded
byline: Four Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero, and six other individuals who were arrested and subsequently remanded for allegedly violating coastal conservation laws by placing a Buddha statue at the Trincomalee Bodhiraja Viharaya have been further remanded.

title: Case against ex-President Ranil to be reconsidered today
byline: The case filed against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe under the Public Property Act is scheduled to be taken up for consideration again today (28) at the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: Tourist arrivals in 2026 top 220,000
byline: A total of 223,645 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in 2026, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Dambulla Thunders’ ex-owner gets suspended sentence for LPL match-fixing, fined Rs. 24M
byline: The former owner of the ‘Dambulla Thunders’ franchise, Tamim Rahman, who pleaded guilty to influencing a cricketer participating in the Lanka Premier League (LPL) 2024 to engage in match-fixing, was fined and given a suspended prison sentence today (28).

title: IMF staff concludes visit to Sri Lanka
byline: The team of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) led by Evan Papageorgiou, which arrived in Colombo last week has concluded the visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake remanded
byline: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake has been remanded until February 11 by the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter stated.

title: President, IMF team agree to continue EFF programme without any changes
byline: The team from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) which arrived last week on a fact-finding mission has indicated that there would be no changes to the agreement relating to the Extended Fund Facility programme being implemented with Sri Lanka during a meeting with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: India contains Nipah virus outbreak, some Asian countries tighten health screenings
byline: Indian authorities said they had contained a Nipah virus outbreak after confirming two cases in the eastern state of West Bengal, as several Asian countries tightened health screenings and airport surveillance for travelers arriving from India.

title: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe appears before court
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe appeared before the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today in connection with a scheduled legal proceeding.

title: Gold vaults past $5,200 to record high
byline: Gold surged above $5,200 an ounce on Wednesday to a record high, extending a historic rally ⁠as economic and geopolitical uncertainty drove demand for ⁠the ⁠safe-haven yellow metal.

title: Namal, Karnataka CM hold talks to explore opportunities for Indo-Sri Lanka collaboration
byline: The National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Namal Rajapaksa met with Chief Minister of Karnataka Siddaramaiah today (28) at the Chief Minister’s official residence in Bangalore.

title: No major impact on Sri Lanka’s economic growth due to Cyclone Ditwah - CBSL Governor
byline: Despite an initially shock, the impact of Cyclone Ditwah which caused widespread devastation to several parts of the country is unlikely to affect Sri Lanka’s economic growth in 2026, the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe has confirmed.

title: Charges will be filed against ex-President Ranil in March; AG informs court
byline: The Attorney General informed the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today that investigations into former President Ranil Wickremesinghe will be completed within a month, and that formal charges are expected to be filed in March.

title: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake arrives at Fort Magistrate’s Court
byline: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake has appeared before the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter stated.

title: Sri Lanka inks bilateral debt relief deal with Belgium’s Credendo
byline: Sri Lanka has entered into a bilateral agreement with CREDENDO – the Export Credit Agency of Belgium to reschedule an outstanding external debt amounting to 9.6 million euros, as part of the Government’s ongoing external debt restructuring efforts aimed at restoring debt sustainability and strengthening economic recovery.

title: Former UNP councillor arrested for foreign employment scam using Foreign Minister’s letterhead
byline: Officers of the Special Investigation Unit of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) have arrested a former member of the Yatinuwara Pradeshiya Sabha representing United National Party (UNP) for allegedly engaging in foreign employment racket by fraudulently using the letterhead of Minister of Foreign Affairs...

title: China, Sri Lanka to set up renminbi clearing arrangements
byline: The People’s Bank of China has recently signed a memorandum of cooperation with the Central Bank of Sri Lanka to establish renminbi clearing arrangements in Sri Lanka, said a statement released by China’s central bank on Wednesday.

title: SOC reviews NATA and Jaffna Teaching Hospital operations
byline: An institutional review of the National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol (NATA) and the Jaffna Teaching Hospital was conducted at the Sectoral Oversight Committee (SOC) on Health, Mass Media and Women’s Empowerment.

title: LCC recovered USD 2.1 mln from supplier after substandard coal import – GM
byline: The General Manager of the Lanka Coal Company (LCC), Namal Hewage, stated that a penalty of approximately USD 2.1 million was recovered from a supplier after a shipment of coal was found to be substandard.

title: GMOA gives Health Minister 48 hours to respond
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has stated that its ongoing trade union action will be further intensified if the government fails to provide a positive response to their issues within the next 48 hours.
